column4: i ignored and tried sudo apt-get install firefox-3.0 but i still got the E: Couldn't find package firefox-3.0 error
i guess i should get rid of my unsupported repo
how do i remove the unsupported repo? i don't even remember how i added that
it's been a while since i haven't used this machine
it'll be in /etc/apt/sources.list or a file in /etc/apt/sources.list.d
put a copy of your /etc/apt/sources.list on paste.ubuntu.com
some; backports essentially scratches some dev's itch.
not really. I usually just enable it, install what I want, then disable
I also use some ppa's, but those are more iffy. Really depends on who's maintaining it

they're for individual dev's or teams to push out test packages for stuff that's not readily available. And right now, no ppa's. I've used a couple for compiz stuff and fixes to wireless, but everythings ok for me right now
how do you go about finding the URL of a PPA? like for example i want to find the PPA for intrepid for cheese, I googled it but nothing useful comes up...
when jaunty comes out, you'll be offered a chance to upgrade to jaunty during an update-manager run
I've usually found references to them in bug reports ;)
I didn't see your problem, why you want a ppa: is it for your webcam?
